channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon joins the big nuclear party, buying 1.92 GW for AWS
item.description: Amazon and Talen revised an existing deal to buy power from the Susquehanna nuclear power plant.

item.title: Trump Wants to Kill California’s Emissions Standards. Here’s What That Means for EVs
item.description: Experts say that disrupting the electrification plans for the US car fleet could lead to long-term pain.

item.title: 5 Best Totes for Travel in 2025, Tested and Reviewed by WIRED
item.description: These hard-working travel totes handle everything from a work trip to a weekend getaway.

item.title: Apple’s Liquid Glass design is paving the way for AR glasses
item.description: This visual overhaul gives us a glimpse into the design of Apple's rumored AR glasses, which will reportedly debut next year.

item.title: Startups Weekly: No sign of pause
item.description: This week brought us many reminders that no startup journey is linear — but the next billion-dollar idea may only be one click away.

item.title: CBP's Predator Drone Flights Over LA Are a Dangerous Escalation
item.description: Custom and Border Protection flying powerful Predator B drones over Los Angeles further breaks the seal on federal involvement in civilian matters typ...

item.title: Google tests Audio Overviews for Search queries
item.description: Google Search is testing Audio Overviews for certain search queries, the company announced on Friday.

item.title: 9 Best 2-in-1 Laptops (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: These 2-in-1 computers upgrade the norm with touchscreen displays, 360-degree hinges, and detachable keyboards.

item.title: The Chatbot Disinfo Inflaming the LA Protests
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, our senior politics editor discusses the spread of disinformation online following the onset of the Los Angeles pro...

item.title: Silicon Valley tech execs are joining the US Army Reserve
item.description: CTOs from companies including OpenAI, Meta, and Palantir make up this first cohort of CTOs in the Army Reserve.
